meanings.definition: clumsy or awkward in movement or behavior
meanings.sent1: She felt klutzier than usual while trying to dance.
meanings.sent2: The puppy was klutzier than the older dogs at the park.
meanings.sent3: Despite his best efforts, he always ended up being klutzier than a clown on stilts.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers turned into klutzier tentacles as she tried to untangle the necklace.
meanings.sent5: The klutzier steps he took on the ice made everyone laugh.

meanings.definition: more clumsy or awkward than someone or something else
meanings.sent1: Out of all the contestants, she was klutzier than the rest.
meanings.sent2: The new model was klutzier than the previous one.
meanings.sent3: The race became a competition of who could be klutzier than the other.
meanings.sent4: His excuses for being late were getting klutzier by the minute.
meanings.sent5: The storm made the weather even klutzier than before.
